torch.description: In PyTorch before trunk/89695, torch.jit.annotations.parse_type_line can cause arbitrary code execution because eval is used unsafely.
torch.name: CVE-2022-45907
torch.title: CVE-2022-45907 - torch

torch.reason_to_ignore: Binaries are patched for this but scanner does not check code
torch.description:
[torch](https://pypi.org/project/torch) is a Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU acceleration

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Command Injection in `torch.jit.annotations.parse_type_line` which can cause arbitrary code execution because `eval` is used unsafely.
torch.name: SNYK-PYTHON-TORCH-3149871
torch.title: IN1-PYTHON-TORCH-3149871 - torch

cryptography.reason_to_ignore: There is currently no released fix version from cryptography
cryptography.description: If an X.509 certificate contains a malformed policy constraint and policy processing is enabled, then a write lock will be taken twice recursively. On some operating systems (most widely: Windows) this results in a denial of service when the affected process hangs. Policy processing being enabled on a publicly facing server is not considered to be a common setup. Policy processing is enabled by passing the `-policy' argument to the command line utilities or by calling either `X509_VERIFY_PARAM_add0_policy()' or `X509_VERIFY_PARAM_set1_policies()' functions.
cryptography.name: CVE-2022-3996
cryptography.title: CVE-2022-3996 - cryptography
